feature.name: daily wage calculation
feature.description: Operational reality summary for "daily wage calculation" based on Jira evidence: - Findings / issues / limitations: 17 - Troubleshooting / edge cases / requests: 17 - Evidence suggests asynchronous updates or synchronization considerations. - Evidence includes UI/visibility or copy/label concerns.

findings.group_description: Current system lacks automated daily wage calculation based on actual working days
findings.issue_explanation: Client requires an automated salary payout system that calculates salary based on 26 working days per month, with dynamic adjustments for extra or fewer worked days
findings.limitation_statement: The payroll system cannot automatically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days
findings.gap_statement: Missing automated, attendance-driven salary calculation mechanism that can dynamically prorate salary without manual interventions

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation has inconsistent formula configuration between leave policy and payroll settings, with payroll settings taking precedence for unpaid leave.
findings.issue_explanation: The system allows payroll settings to override leave policy daily wage formulas, which causes user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
findings.limitation_statement: The system does not synchronize daily wage formula configurations between leave policy and payroll modules.
findings.gap_statement: There is no clear visual communication about how and why formula overrides occur.

findings.group_description: System incorrectly handles leap year calculations for daily wage and end of service gratuity computations
findings.issue_explanation: The gratuity calculator is not correctly accounting for 366 days in 2024, instead using 365 days, which results in an inaccurate service period calculation and lower gratuity amount
findings.limitation_statement: Cannot automatically adjust calculations for leap years in service period computations
findings.gap_statement: The system requires enhancement to dynamically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) pro-rated amount calculation produces consistently lower amounts due to decimal precision errors
findings.issue_explanation: When calculating daily wage for pro-rated EOS amounts, the system shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points, affecting all employees regardless of departure date
findings.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation engine lacks precise decimal handling for pro-rated salary computations
findings.gap_statement: The system needs enhanced rounding and decimal precision mechanisms for financial calculations

findings.group_description: End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculation involves complex service duration and daily wage computation with tiered rates and prorated partial years.
findings.issue_explanation: System calculates gratuity using daily wage divided by 30, with different rates for service periods (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after 5 years), and prorates partial years by dividing days by 365.
findings.limitation_statement: System cannot automatically prorate leave accrual for mid-month departures, requiring manual adjustment for incomplete months.
findings.gap_statement: Lack of flexible leave accrual handling for employees departing mid-month creates manual intervention requirements.

findings.group_description: System's handling of leap year days in service duration calculation causes minor discrepancies in gratuity computation
findings.issue_explanation: The platform calculates service days slightly differently when a leap year is involved, potentially missing the extra day (February 29th) which impacts total service duration calculation
findings.limitation_statement: The system's day counting methodology for leap years is not transparently documented, causing confusion about precise service duration calculation
findings.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation explaining how leap year days are handled in service duration and gratuity calculations

findings.group_description: The daily wage calculation for gratuity involves complex logic for handling service periods, especially for periods above 5 years and partial years including leap years.
findings.issue_explanation: The system calculates gratuity using a nuanced approach that differs from manual calculations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting.
findings.limitation_statement: The gratuity calculation methodology is not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
findings.gap_statement: There is a need for a more detailed, user-friendly explanation of the gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples showing how service duration is calculated.

findings.group_description: System uses a fixed 30-day divisor for daily wage calculation that cannot be customized
findings.issue_explanation: Platform calculates daily wage by dividing basic salary by 30 days, which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365)
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a hardcoded 30-day divisor that cannot be modified via configuration
findings.gap_statement: No flexibility to configure alternative daily wage calculation methods

findings.group_description: System calculates daily wage using a predefined policy configuration that may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations.
findings.issue_explanation: User reported a discrepancy in leave salary calculation, believing the daily wage should be divided by 31 (calendar days) but the system was dividing by 30, resulting in a different prorated salary amount.
findings.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
findings.gap_statement: There's a potential product gap in providing more transparent explanations of how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

findings.group_description: Daily wage calculation varies based on monthly working days, causing inconsistent leave salary accrual reporting
findings.issue_explanation: The leave encashment settings in the daily wage calculator use a 'working days' method, which causes calculation variations across months with different working day counts
findings.limitation_statement: The system calculates daily wage based on working days per month, leading to fluctuating accrual amounts
findings.gap_statement: The platform lacks a way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with varying working days

findings.group_description: System calculates daily wage using separate configurations for leave salary and salary proration, which can lead to calculation mismatches
findings.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculation uses different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days) for leave salary and salary proration, causing inconsistent prorated amounts
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically align leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations
findings.gap_statement: There is no unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios

findings.group_description: Misunderstanding about how daily wage proration calculates working days based on work week configuration
findings.issue_explanation: User initially believed salary proration was incorrect, but the system was actually calculating correctly based on the employee's work week configuration where all 7 days are marked as working days
findings.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional weekend expectations

findings.group_description: Inconsistent salary proration for offboarded employees based on departure date timing
findings.issue_explanation: The system fails to consistently prorate salary when an employee's departure date differs from payroll processing date. Specifically, when departure date is in the future, full salary is displayed instead of prorated amount.
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator cannot handle dynamic proration scenarios where departure date differs from payroll processing date
findings.gap_statement: Lack of robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

findings.group_description: System calculates daily wage with unexpected variations due to public holiday timing and working days configuration
findings.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes inconsistent between Time Off and Payroll modules, resulting in incorrect salary deductions
findings.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change
findings.gap_statement: Lack of real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules prevents accurate working days calculation

findings.group_description: System calculates daily wage deductions using a non-standard divisor that can produce unexpected results
findings.issue_explanation: The payroll system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that differ from user expectations
findings.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30.42-day divisor that may not align with user's intuitive monthly salary expectations
findings.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for how daily wage deductions are calculated when an employee is on unpaid leave

findings.group_description: System displays incorrect daily rate remarks for unpaid leave deduction, specifically for February calculations
findings.issue_explanation: The platform shows 925.81 (based on 31 days) instead of 989.66 (based on 29 days for February) in the remarks field, even though the actual deduction calculation is mathematically correct
findings.limitation_statement: Remarks field does not dynamically adjust to actual calendar days for different months
findings.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks

findings.group_description: System displays daily wage rate from payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month, causing user confusion
findings.issue_explanation: The daily rate displayed does not match the month when leave was actually taken, showing the rate from the payroll month instead of the leave occurrence month
findings.limitation_statement: The system recalculates daily rates based on payroll processing month rather than storing the original leave occurrence month rate
findings.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for lack of automated daily wage calculation
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee

troubleshooting.group_description: Users need to understand how daily wage formulas are configured across different system modules.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings, as it will override leave policy formulas for unpaid leave.

troubleshooting.group_description: Workaround for incorrect leap year calculations in daily wage and gratuity computations
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify total days worked, ensuring 366 days are counted for 2024, and cross-check calculations with MOHRE guidelines

troubleshooting.group_description: Manually verify End of Service calculations to ensure accuracy
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Double-check pro-rated amounts manually and cross-reference with expected calculations

troubleshooting.group_description: For mid-month departures with incomplete leave accrual, manual adjustment in the EOS section is possible.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution:
1. Check leave policy type (monthly vs conditional accrual)
2. If monthly accrual, leave days are only earned at month-end
3. Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section if needed

troubleshooting.group_description: When discrepancies arise in gratuity calculation, users can manually verify and potentially override the system-generated amount
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate gratuity using: (Basic Salary / 30) * 21 days per year * total service years, cross-checking system's calculation

troubleshooting.group_description: Detailed explanation of how gratuity is calculated for different service periods, especially for periods spanning more than 5 years.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Carefully track service duration, breaking it into segments (first 5 years at 21 days per year, subsequent years at 30 days per year), and account for partial years by calculating exact days and using appropriate divisor (365 or 366 for leap years).

troubleshooting.group_description: When platform's daily wage calculation differs from expectations, manual verification is recommended
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually cross-check daily wage by calculating (Basic Salary × 12 / 365) separately from platform calculation

troubleshooting.group_description: When encountering discrepancies in leave salary calculation, users should verify the daily rate configuration in the leave policy.
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Check the policy configuration to understand how daily wage is calculated, specifically the divisor used for prorating salary (30 vs 31 days).

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving daily wage calculation inconsistencies by adjusting configuration settings
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Users can switch to 'custom days' setting in leave encashment to maintain consistent daily wage calculation

troubleshooting.group_description: To resolve calculation discrepancies, manual configuration alignment is required
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually configure both leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations to use the same divisor (e.g., 30.42 days)

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving daily wage proration confusion by checking work week settings
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Verify employee's work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated, especially in cases with non-standard work weeks

troubleshooting.group_description: Manual workaround for salary proration when system fails
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary by dividing monthly salary by 30 and multiplying by days worked (e.g., 21,000/30 * 15 = AED 10,500 for partial month)

troubleshooting.group_description: Handling inconsistent daily wage calculations when public holidays are added late
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction can be added to correct the salary calculation, or previous payroll cycles can be reopened (though not recommended)

troubleshooting.group_description: How to calculate daily wage deduction for unpaid leave
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: To calculate unpaid leave deduction: Divide monthly salary by 30.42 (custom days), then multiply by number of unpaid leave days

troubleshooting.group_description: Verifying daily wage calculations for unpaid leave, especially in months with variable days
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: Double-check actual deduction amount, not just the remarks field. Confirm calculation uses correct calendar days (29 for February in leap year).

troubleshooting.group_description: Resolving confusion around daily wage rate display across different payroll months
troubleshooting.workaround_or_resolution: System deployed a fix to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount instead of recalculating every time

glossary.definition: Days considered as working days based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days of the week depending on company policy
Calculation of an employee's daily rate by dividing total monthly salary (basic + allowances) by a specific number of days (typically 30 or 30.42)
Calculation of salary reduction for days not worked, based on daily rate and actual calendar days in the month

End of service benefit calculated based on an employee's basic salary, length of service, and contract type, typically using a formula of daily wage multiplied by days per year based on total service duration
A year containing 366 days instead of the standard 365 days, occurring every 4 years, which requires special handling in date and service period calculations
A proportional salary calculation for partial periods, typically computed by dividing total salary by 30 days and multiplying by days worked
Leave policy where employees earn leave days only at the end of each completed month, not prorated for partial months.
Leave policy where employees earn leave days daily instead of waiting until month-end, allowing more flexible leave balance tracking.
Total number of working days an employee has worked, calculated by dividing total days by 365, with special consideration for leap years and including the departure date

End of service benefit calculation that uses different rates for service periods (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year for subsequent years), with special handling for partial years and leap years.
The number of days used to divide the monthly salary when calculating daily wage, which can be configured in the leave policy and may differ from the actual calendar days in a month.
Cumulative calculation of vacation leave monetary value, which can vary based on monthly working days configuration
Adjusting an employee's salary based on the actual days worked or days of leave taken in a month
Partial salary calculation based on actual days worked, typically calculated by dividing monthly salary by total calendar days and multiplying by days actually worked
A fixed value of 30.42 used to calculate the daily rate of an employee's monthly salary, instead of using exact calendar days
